pages.title: Temperature Regulator
pages.text: The <item>Temperature Regulator/$ is a powerful tool for controlling <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$. It allows precisely controlling the <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$ of a <item>$(l:essentials:heat/cable)heat cable/$ and connected machines.$(br2)The <item>temperature regulator/$ connects to two <item>$(l:essentials:heat/cable)heat cables/$- on the front and back- with the front being

The <item>temperature regulator/$ has two modes: Red mode and blue mode, which can be toggled by shift-right-clicking with a <item>$(l:essentials/wrench)wrench/$.$(br2)In red mode, heat will be moved from the input to the output up to the target <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$, but no hotter. It can not heat the front higher than the back. In effect, it heats the output up to a set <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$.$(br2)

In blue mode, heat will be moved from the output to the input down to the target <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$, but no colder. It can not cool the front lower than the back. In effect, it cools the output down to a set <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$.$(br2)

There are two variants of the <item>temperature regulator/$: The <item>Temperature Regulator/$ has the target <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$ in Celcius set via a UI, while the <item>Redstone Temperature Regulator/$ has the target <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)temperature/$ in Celcius set to the current <thing>$(l:essentials/circuit)circuit/$ input.$(br2)
